author: nrryuya
content:
Hi. My team is researching the economics/users' behavior of Eth2 in a project called Shargri-La. 
https://ethresear.ch/t/shargri-la-a-transaction-level-sharded-blockchain-simulator/7936
Motivated by the Rollup-centric roadmap, we are now looking at the economics of Phase 1.

Since there is no "transaction" in the Phase 1 spec, I'm curious about whether only block proposers are assumed to put data on shards, or there is some off-chain mechanism for users to request validators to put their data on shards. For example, users and Eth2 validators can use Eth1 to make a contract like "if a validator *V* puts the data whose hash is *h* on Eth2 within *N* slots, *V* can receive *X* ETH." Without such a mechanism, Rollup operators must be Eth2 validators.
https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/a-rollup-centric-ethereum-roadmap/4698/43

I found a related issue that mentions the out-of-band fee mechanism, but it seems discussing about Phase 2.
https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/issues/1280

author: djrtwo
content:
Yes, there must be a fee market for shard data. Likely this would need to be resolved in the eth1 shard (before a merge, eth1 can learn about eth2 via a contract based light client)

I wrote a simple contract based fee market proposal the other day

https://notes.ethereum.org/-_I3i4uNRTeGRUc73zVTTQ

This requires a relatively high load of on chain txs so thats not desirable on L1

author: djrtwo
content:
Vitalik proposed a more sophisticated system a couple of days ago

https://ethresear.ch/t/a-fee-market-contract-for-eth2-shards-in-eth1/8124

author: djrtwo
content: Some of the details there are specific to the pre-merge phase 1, but most of the mechanics can be reused when eth1 is natively integrated into the beacon chain consensus

author: nrryuya
content: Thank you! These are exactly what I want. We will learn them and think about what kinds of research we can do.
